 Propaganda possessed a distinctive Germanic style that set them apart from their synth-pop rivals of the Eighties.
 Their influence can be heard in acts as diverse as Depeche Mode, Daft Punk and even popette Sophie Ellis Bextor, who covered "Duel".
 This 2CD set celebrates their key singles like "Duel", "Dr Mabuse" and "p:Machinery" and includes detailed sleevenotes and a fold-out poster.
